newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian oil shares dominate slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian oil shares dominate slow trade.

text.p: Oil shares maintained their position as the most sought after stocks on the Nigerian exchange in slow Thursday trade.
The all-share index closed at 6,598.04 from 6,586.89 on Wednesday.
Traders said investors quiting other sectors were responsible for the growing demand for oil marketing shares.
African Petroleum led the field, rising 85 kobo to 34.50 naira.
The only faller in the sector was Afroil, a small indigenous firm, which fell by one kobo to 36 kobo.
Shares of Ashaka and West African Portland Cement rose by 20 kobo each to 19.10 naira and 35.00 naira respectively.
Nestle Foods went up by 30 kobo to 34.60 naira but Cadbury fell five kobo to 26.50 naira.
NAL Merchant Bank added 20 kobo to 5.60 naira while Union Bank, one of the big three, dropped five kobo to 7.75 naira.
Other fallers included Guinness, down 15 kobo to 7.45 naira, Dunlop, 10 kobo lower at 11.05 naira, CFAO and UAC, shedding 10 kobo to end at 4.00 and 10.00 naira respectively.
Large volumes of these blue chip stocks remain on offer.
Paint companies also took a hit. Berger Paints slide 15 kobo to 5.35 naira. Nigerian-German Chemicals fell five kobo to 9.30 naira and Premier Paints finished three kobo lower at 85 kobo.
